001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.io.Serial;
004import java.util.Random;
005import java.util.stream.IntStream;
006
007import static java.util.stream.Collectors.joining;
008import static java.util.stream.IntStream.range;
009import static java.util.stream.IntStream.rangeClosed;
010import static org.apache.commons.lang3.ArrayUtils.swap;
011import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreStreamUtils.reversedArr;
012
013/**
014 * Helper-wrapper over standard {@link Random} to generate random arrays and collections
015 */
016public class RandomHelper extends Random {
017
018    @Serial
019    private static final long serialVersionUID = 123456789_002L;
020
021    public RandomHelper() {
022        super(); // non-reproducible random sequences !!!
023    }
024
025    public RandomHelper(long seed) {
026        super(seed);
027    }
028
029    public String randomLowerCase(int len) {
030        return ints(len, 'a', 'z' + 1)
031            .mapToObj(chInt -> (char)chInt)
032            .map(String::valueOf)
033            .collect(joining());
034    }
035
036    public String randomUpperCase(int len) {
037        return ints(len, 'A', 'Z' + 1)
038            .mapToObj(chInt -> (char)chInt)
039            .map(String::valueOf)
040            .collect(joining());
041    }
042
043    public int[] randomRangeArr(int lowBound, int highBound) {
044        return shuffle(range(lowBound, highBound));
045    }
046
047    public int[] randomRangeClosedArr(int lowBound, int highBound) {
048        return shuffle(rangeClosed(lowBound, highBound));
049    }
050
051    public int[] shuffle(IntStream values) {
052        int[] valuesArr = values.toArray();
053        shuffleArr(valuesArr);
054        return valuesArr;
055    }
056
057    public void shuffleArr(int[] valuesArr) {
058        // a little bit more efficient than using Collections.shuffle and subsequence copying
059        for (int i = valuesArr.length; i > 1; i--) {
060            swap(valuesArr, i - 1, nextInt(valuesArr.length));
061        }
062    }
063
064    public int[] randomDistinctIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
065        return ints(5 * N, lowBound, highBound)
066            .distinct().limit(N).toArray();
067    }
068
069    public int[] randomSortedIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
070        return ints(N, lowBound, highBound)
071            .sorted().limit(N).toArray();
072    }
073
074    public int[] randomSortedReversedIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
075        return reversedArr(randomSortedIntArr(N, lowBound, highBound));
076    }
077
078    public int[] randomIncreasingIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
079        return ints(5 * N, lowBound, highBound)
080            .distinct().limit(N).sorted().toArray();
081    }
082
083    public int[] randomDecreasingIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
084        return reversedArr(randomIncreasingIntArr(N, lowBound, highBound));
085    }
086
087    public int[] zeroIntArr(long N) {
088        return constantIntArr(N, 0);
089    }
090
091    public int[] constantIntArr(long N, int constant) {
092        return IntStream.generate(() -> constant).limit(N).toArray();
093    }
094}
